physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination revealed dry skin and hypotonia. No goiter was present.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After initiating thyroid hormone replacement therapy, TSH levels decreased to 1.87 mU/liter at age 13.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination at 2 weeks showed dry skin and an open posterior fontanel; no goiter was found.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Thyroid hormone replacement therapy was initiated, and ultrasound conducted at 9 years showed a normally positioned thyroid gland of normal size.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hearing loss was progressive, with thresholds at 55 dB on the right and 80 dB on the left at age 4.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No significant physical examination findings reported, as the patient was clinically unaffected.
Thyroid function tests were normal at the time of evaluation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Thyroid function remained within normal range while on replacement therapy.
